intro: Uragoga subulata, commonly known as the slender uragoga, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its narrow, needle-like leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
